conclusion: Determine the net force acting on the sled and child.
Use the given angle and trigonometric values to find the horizontal force component.
Calculate the magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground using Newton's second law.
The image shows a child sitting on a sled, which is being pulled by an adult at an angle of 37° above the horizontal.
The sled and child are moving at a constant speed along the horizontal ground.
The child has a mass of 30kg and the sled has a mass of 10kg.
The adult applies a force F of 100N at an angle of 37° above the horizontal.
The horizontal component of the force Fx is given by Fx = F cos 37°.
Since the sled is moving at a constant speed, the net force acting on it is zero.
The vertical component of the force Fy must balance the weight mg of the sled and child.
The vertical component Fy is given by Fy = F sin 37° = 100N × 0.6 = 60N.
The magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is the vertical component Fy, which is 60N.
